key_diagnoses: Stage IIIB non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), on chemoradiation

relevant_sops.title: Anticoagulation Management with Active Bleeding
key_steps: Immediately hold anticoagulation therapy
Notify attending physician and oncology team
Assess severity of bleeding (vital signs, hemoglobin trend)
Type and screen, consider crossmatch if severe
Consider reversal agents if life-threatening bleeding

relevant_sops.title: Neutropenic Fever Management
key_steps: Immediately obtain blood cultures (2 sets from different sites)
Start broad-spectrum antibiotics within 60 minutes of fever onset
Assess for source of infection (respiratory, urinary, skin, line)
Institute neutropenic precautions (private room, mask, hand hygiene)
Monitor vital signs every 4 hours minimum

relevant_sops.title: Oxygen Therapy Management for Hypoxia
key_steps: Assess airway, breathing, circulation (ABCs)
Apply supplemental oxygen to maintain SpO2 > 92% (or per patient-specific target)
Document oxygen delivery device and flow rate
Order arterial blood gas if severe hypoxia or COPD
Auscultate lungs, assess work of breathing

relevant_sops.title: Pain Management in Cancer Patients
key_steps: Assess pain using validated scale (0-10 numeric rating)
Determine if pain is acute, chronic, or breakthrough
Review current pain regimen and recent doses given
For moderate-severe pain (>6/10), administer PRN opioid per orders
Reassess pain 30-60 minutes after intervention

relevant_sops.title: Chemotherapy Administration Safety
key_steps: Verify patient identity using two identifiers
Confirm informed consent documented
Review pre-chemotherapy labs (CBC, metabolic panel, LFTs)
Verify chemotherapy dose calculations
Administer pre-medications as ordered (antiemetics, steroids)

applicable_policies.title: Neutropenic Precautions
applicable_policies.requirement: Patients with ANC < 500 or severely immunocompromised require neutropenic precautions

applicable_policies.title: Pain Assessment and Treatment
applicable_policies.requirement: Pain must be assessed on admission, with vital signs, and within 1 hour of pain intervention

treatment_guidelines.title: NSCLC Stage-Based Treatment Overview
treatment_guidelines.recommendation: Systemic therapy based on molecular testing and PD-L1 status

treatment_guidelines.title: Venous Thromboembolism in Cancer
treatment_guidelines.recommendation: Cancer patients have elevated VTE risk; prophylaxis and treatment differ from non-cancer patients

treatment_guidelines.title: Neutropenia Management in Chemotherapy
treatment_guidelines.recommendation: G-CSF prophylaxis recommended when febrile neutropenia risk >= 20%

treatment_guidelines.title: Brain Metastases in NSCLC
treatment_guidelines.recommendation: Management depends on number of metastases, symptoms, and systemic disease control

treatment_guidelines.title: Immunotherapy in NSCLC
treatment_guidelines.recommendation: Immunotherapy is first-line for metastatic NSCLC without driver mutations

warnings.message: Patient on anticoagulation with active hemoptysis - review need for anticoagulation
warnings.evidence: Active bleeding is a contraindication to anticoagulation

warnings.message: Neutropenic fever - requires immediate evaluation and antibiotics
warnings.action_required: Blood cultures and broad-spectrum antibiotics within 60 minutes
Titrate oxygen, assess work of breathing, consider chest imaging

warnings.message: Relevant protocol triggered: Anticoagulation Management with Active Bleeding
warnings.action_required: Review SOP SOP-AC-001 and ensure compliance

warnings.message: Relevant protocol triggered: Neutropenic Fever Management
warnings.action_required: Review SOP SOP-NF-001 and ensure compliance
